content: The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" is the short title of the Act. It includes a permanent extension of modifications to the Earned Income Tax Credit. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, such as increasing the credit percentage for families with 3 or more children and raising the income threshold for joint returns. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by increasing the credit percentage for families with 3 or more children and raising the income threshold for joint returns. It also adjusts certain subsections and removes a paragraph in Section 32(b) of the Code. These amendments will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" strengthens the Earned Income Tax Credit by increasing the credit percentage for families with 3 or more children and raising the income threshold for joint returns. If an individual is claimed as a qualifying child by a parent, no other custodial parent without a claim may be considered eligible for the credit. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.
